Panda Express Orange Chicken

376
Editors' Pick
Submitted by flume027
"A copycat recipe from Panda Express. This chicken is tangy and flavorful. Give it a try! I'm sure you and your family will enjoy it."
 
watch
  • MORE
Ready In:
45mins
Serves:
Units:
Nutrition Information

ingredients

  • 2 lbs boneless skinless chicken, chopped into bite-sized pieces
  • 1 egg
  • 1 1⁄2 teaspoons salt
  • white pepper
  • oil (for frying)
  • 1⁄2 cup cornstarch
  • 1⁄4 cup flour

  • Orange Sauce

  • 3 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 3⁄4 cup orange juice
  • 1⁄2 cup brown sugar
  • 1 orange, zest of
  • 1 tablespoon oil
  • 2 tablespoons gingerroot, minced
  • 2 teaspoons garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon red chili pepper flakes
  • 1⁄2 cup green onion, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons rice wine
  • 1⁄2 cup water
  • 2 tablespoons cornstarch
  • 1 teaspoon sesame oil

directions

  • Place chicken pieces in a large bowl, set aside.
  • In a medium bowl, stir egg, salt, pepper and 1 tablespoon oil and mix well, set aside.
  • In a medium bowl, stir together 1/2 cup of the cornstarch and the flour.
  • Heat oil for deep-frying in wok or deep-fryer to 375 degrees.
  • Dip chicken pieces into egg mixture, then into the flour mixture, shaking off any excess.
  • Add chicken to wok in small batches and fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until golden brown.
  • (Do not overcook chicken).
  • Remove chicken from oil with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels; set aside.

  • FOR THE SAUCE:

  • In a small bowl, combine the soy sauce, orange juice, brown sugar and orange zest. Set aside.
  • Clean wok and heat 15 seconds over high heat.
  • Add 1 tablespoon oil, the gingerroot, garlic, crushed red chili pepper flakes and green onions and stir-fry for just a few seconds until fragrant.
  • Now, add the rice wine and the soy sauce mixture you set aside above.
  • Add cooked chicken, stirring until well mixed.
  • In a small bowl, stir together the water and cornstarch, then add it to the wok and stir until sauce has thickened. Add sesame oil if desired.
  • Serve over jasmine rice.
Submit a Recipe Correction

sort by:
  1. review by Amanda L.
    1/26/2022
    I loved this recipe, very tasty. Just follow the tips and it works.
     
  2. review by julia_manke1
    11/28/2021
    This recipe was a hit! I made this as a birthday dinner for a friend who could no longer eat at Panda Express because of newly diagnosed allergies. She really missed the orange chicken, and appreciated such a close copycat! I subbed rice flour for the regular flour, and made a rice flour/water slurry to replace the egg. It came out perfectly! Thanks for the great recipe!
     
  3. question by Magnus B.
    10/6/2021
    Where do I buy the panda????
     
  4. review by annemichellex
    6/24/2021
    Delicious recipe. The family loved it and I'll make it again. But we all agreed it was spicier and less sweet than Panda Express. Not a big deal... I just wanted a good orange chicken recipe. If I were dedicated to making it taste more like PE I'd increase the sugar, decrease the pepper flakes, and get the oil hotter before frying (400 degrees or more.)
     
  5. review by nancywarnick
    4/26/2021
    Delicious. I didn’t have an orange for the zest, just orange juice, but it still had great flavor. Make sure you are organized. That’s the most important. Definitely a keeper!
